title: Centuries of Stargazing Leave Jesuit Names Written in the Heavens
description: The latest list of approved labels for asteroids includes nods to three more scholars of the order, as well as a pope, challenging the idea that science and religion make awkward partners.

title: Zelensky Makes Morale-Boosting Trip to Bakhmut
description: The Ukrainian leader also condemned a deadly Russian missile attack against an apartment building in Zaporizhzhia.

title: The DeSantis Foreign Policy: Hard Power, but With a High Bar
description: The Florida governor has never been the internationalist that some old-guard Republicans wanted or imagined him to be. A close reading of his record reveals how he might lead the U.S. abroad.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: U.S. Raises Interest Rates
description: Also, China and Russia grow closer and the U.S. waits for news of a possible Donald Trump indictment.

title: Prince William Makes Visit to Poland to Thank Troops Supporting Ukraine
description: He is expected to meet with Poland’s president, Andrzej Duda, on Thursday, according to a Kensington Palace statement shared with Polish and British news media.

title: Ship Tips Over at Edinburgh Port, Injuring Dozens
description: A research vessel previously owned by the Microsoft co-founder Paul G. Allen became dislodged while docked. The cause of the accident was under investigation.

title: U.K. Defends Sending Ukraine Weapons with Depleted Uranium
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia falsely claimed the material had a “nuclear component.” Many armies, including Russia’s, use it in weapons.

title: U.K. Lawmakers Approve Stormont Brake in Northern Ireland Brexit Deal
description: An important element of the agreement known as the Windsor Framework, a Brexit provision negotiated with the European Union, was roundly endorsed in the British Parliament.

title: In Paris, Protests Over Pension Law Take On a Hint of Menace
description: Peaceful solidarity alternates with the threat of violence, and all of France waits to see which way the standoff will turn.

title: Macron Denounces Violent Protests in France
description: President Emmanuel Macron of France, in his first remarks since pushing through a rise in the retirement age, was firm and unapologetic.

title: Geothermal Power, Cheap and Clean, Could Help Run Japan. So Why Doesn’t It?
description: For decades, new plants have been blocked by powerful local interests, the owners of hot spring resorts, that say the sites threaten a centuries-old tradition.

title: Boris Johnson Faces Inquiry Over Whether He Lied to U.K. Parliament
description: Boris Johnson told a powerful committee that his statements over parties at his office were “made in good faith.” His political future may be at stake.

title: The I.C.C.’s Arrest Warrant for Putin is More Than ‘Just Symbolic’
description: A different way to think about justice & accountability

title: Uganda Passes Strict Anti-Gay Bill That Imposes Death Penalty for Some
description: The legislation, which now goes to the president, also calls for life in prison for anyone engaging in gay sex. Policies to stifle gay rights have been on the rise in several African nations.

title: In a Brother Act with Putin, Xi Reveals China’s Fear of Containment
description: Instead of focusing on a solution to the war in Ukraine, the Chinese leader’s visit to Moscow reinforced China and Russia’s shared opposition to American dominance.

title: I.M.F. and Ukraine Agree to $15.6 Billion Lending Program
description: The board of the International Monetary Fund is expected to review the deal, aimed at stabilizing the nation’s finances, in the next few weeks. Here’s what we’re covering:

title: The Fed’s Unpleasant Choice
description: What’s worse: More inflation or more turmoil?

title: Russian Faced Prison Time for Instagram Post About War in Ukraine
description: The case of Olesya Krivtsova, a Russian student who ended up on the Kremlin’s official terrorist list, has underscored the perils of using social media to criticize the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine.

title: At Al Aqsa Mosque, Shards of Stained Glass Tell a Story of Conflict
description: Artisans at the contested Jerusalem holy site, known to Jews as the Temple Mount, complain of Israeli interference with their work and face a constant struggle to keep up with repairs after violence flares.

title: As Haiti’s Police Retreat, Gangs Take Over Much of the Capital
description: Even wealthier areas in the capital, Port-au-Prince, are no longer immune to violence as gangs attack police officers and destroy police stations.

title: U.K. Inflation Swings Upward, in a U-Turn
description: Prices in Britain reversed a recent downward trend, rising by 10.4 percent in the year through February.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Closer ties between Russia and China.
